intro: Acronema radiatum, commonly known as the radiate acronema, is a flowering plant native to parts of East Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its small, white or yellowish flowers are arranged in umbels, a common feature in the Apiaceae family. The leaves are finely divided and emit a mild, spicy scent when crushed.
